inclusion.criterion: biochemical evidence of Cushing s disease
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: MRI of the Pituitary gland with and without contrast
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Ability to undergo PET-imaging without general anesthesia
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Clinical diagnosis of Cushing s disease based on documented medical records
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Surgical candidate for resection of ACTH producing pituitary adenoma within 1 weeks of PET-imaging
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Normal liver function as evidenced by liver enzyme tests completed within 14 days before injection of radiopharmaceutical
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: SGOT, SGPT <= 5 x upper limit of normal; bilirubin <= 2 x upper limit of normal

inclusion.criterion: Enrolled in 03-N-0164, Evaluation of Neurosurgical Disorders
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Children: Children age 8 and older are included in this protocol
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: More than half of the patients with CD requiring transsphenoidal surgery at the NIH are children

inclusion.criterion: NIH Employees: Protections for employees and staff participating in this study include:
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Pregnant or lactating women: Pregnant and lactating women will be excluded from participation
inclusion.label: not_met
inclusion.evidence: The PET radiopharmaceutical used in this study can be harmful to a developing fetus

exclusion.criterion: Severe chronic renal insufficiency (glomerular filtration rate < 30 mL/min/1.73 m squared)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Elevated blood glucose level above 200 mg/dL on the day of the scan prior to 18F-FDG administration
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a known case of Acromegaly who underwent transsphenoidal surgery 4 months ago. He has residual pituitary tumor and takes only vitamin D and multivitamins.
